issue.title: What is the structure of the final?

content.raw:
As a second alternative would be to have ROS on both sides. We can control the protocol and bandwidth based on what topics we publish and subscribe to.

I would also show the ROS on the OCU Earth side. On the Mars side you have ROS with IHMC nodes and competitor nodes. On the Earth side you show ROS with competitor nodes. The other ROS tools like RViz and Rqt would subscribe to the OCU competitor node topics and not reach across the wire to the Mars topics. There is still a little overhead to connect the OCU nodes and topics to register with the roscore but hopefully(will need to test) that is limited.

This is the direction that I am heading for now.

I am speculating that we will provide a number of nodes and a launch file to launch those nodes on the Mars side.
